body_content.explanation: to keep one thing separate from another:
examples: The psychiatric section is segregated from the rest of the prison.
The systems will have to be able to segregate clients' money from the firm's own cash.

body_content.explanation: to keep one group of people apart from another and treat them differently, especially because of race, sex, or religion:
examples: Black residents were segregated from white residents in the area.
an urban culture segregated by sex where boys "learned" how to be men

body_content.explanation: (of pairs of alleles (= different forms of the same gene)) to separate during meiosis (= the cell division that happens as part of the process of producing young animals or plants) and pass separately to separate gametes (= reproductive cells):
examples: Disruption of the spindle can cause chromosomes to segregate abnormally at either of the two meiotic divisions.
